revised_title: In vivo and freeze-trapped assays of the energy state in brain and skeletal tissues
tldr: This article discusses the use of 31P nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) to non-invasively assess the energy state of brain and skeletal tissues in small animals. The authors compare the energy-related compound ratios in normoxia and nitrogen anoxia, demonstrating the remarkable retention of ATP levels in newborn gerbils during N2 anoxia.
